Multifaceted industry experience across Oil & Gas, Research & Technology, Hospitality, Manufacturing, Financial services etc.We work to support C suite clients to ensure that they derive value from their very valuable asset: their Employees. 	Translate business goals into annual and quarterly sales plans.
	Develop go-to-market strategies across industries and service lines.
	Lead proposal development, pricing validation, and negotiation.


Pipeline & Revenue Growth:


	Build and manage a strong sales pipeline across consulting, learning, and talent services.
	Ensure structured lead qualification, reporting, tracking, and follow-through.
	Drive consistent revenue generation from corporate and public-sector clients.


Relationship & Key Account Management:


	Build strong C-Suite and business leader relationships.
	Manage key accounts, ensuring loyalty, retention, and cross-sell opportunities.
	Represent the firm externally at conferences, industry events, executive networks, etc.


Market Intelligence & Positioning:


	Monitor industry shifts, policy landscapes, and competitive activity.
	Work with Marketing to strengthen brand visibility and thought leadership.


Collaboration & Leadership:


	Serve as a strategic commercial partner, aligning client needs with delivery priorities and capacity.
	Facilitate cross-unit collaboration to leverage PIC, TBS, and TAF strengths in building integrated client solutions. Work closely with delivery teams to ensure seamless handover, client success, and repeat business.
	Lead internal sales huddles and deal-strategy sessions, driving clarity, discipline, and accountability.
	Mentor and coach BD Specialists and Analysts to build commercial acumen, research depth, and proposal excellence.
	Actively contribute to knowledge development, insight pieces, market playbooks, sector briefs, case libraries.


Job Specifications: Minimum & Preferred Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Marketing or related field (MBA is a plus).


Work Experience:


	8–12 years of experience in selling professional services, enterprise advisory solutions, or B2B consulting offerings (consulting industry is a plus).
	Demonstrated track record in solution-selling to senior executives, public sector leaders, DFIs, and large enterprise clients.
	Proven experience building trust-based commercial relationships and leading consultative sales cycles from lead generation to close.

Job Purpose


	Responsible for leading and executing the sourcing, purchasing, and supplier management activities required to support uninterrupted manufacturing operations.
	The role ensures cost-effective procurement of raw materials, spare parts, consumables, and services, while maintaining the highest standards of quality, compliance, and operational efficiency.


Job Responsibilities


	Develop and implement procurement strategies aligned with production targets and business objectives.
	Identify, evaluate, and onboard reliable suppliers for raw materials, engineering spares, packaging materials, and services.

	Negotiate contracts, pricing, and service-level agreements to ensure optimal value and cost savings.
	Build strong relationships with local and international suppliers.
	Manage supplier performance using KPIs; quality, delivery timeliness, cost, and compliance.
	Lead periodic supplier evaluations, audits, and revalidation exercises.
	Resolve supply issues, disputes, and quality concerns in collaboration with Production and QA/QC.
	Oversee end-to-end procurement cycles; raising PRs, RFQs, bid analysis, PO issuance, expediting, and delivery.
	Ensure timely supply of materials to support production schedules and prevent stockout.
	Collaborate with Warehouse, Logistics, and Production on inventory planning and optimization.
	Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, SOPs, and audit requirements.
	Implement cost-reduction initiatives without compromising quality.
	Support inventory control by ensuring appropriate order quantities (EOQ), safety stock levels, and lead-time management.
	Partner with Finance to track spending, budget adherence, and cost forecasts.
	Identify supply chain risks and develop mitigation plans.
	Ensure proper documentation, contract compliance, and adherence to local and international procurement regulations.

HR / Executive Assistant Job at NXG-HUB Digital Technologies Ltd




        
    

        
        NXG-HUB Digital Technologies Ltd is a Tech startup focused on delivering top notch ICT solutions to individuals and corporate organizations. Our services include ICT Training, Software Development and Technical recruiting.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Executive Assistant
Job Locations: Lagos, & Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	We are seeking a highly organized, intelligent, and proactive HR / Executive Assistant to support executive operations and human resource functions.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Provide high-level administrative and executive support to management
	Manage schedules, meetings, correspondence, and official documentation
	Support HR functions including recruitment coordination, onboarding, records management, and staff documentation
	Maintain confidential files and ensure accurate record-keeping
	Draft professional reports, memos, emails, and internal communications
	Assist with office coordination, task tracking, and follow-ups
	Represent the company at client meetings, corporate visits, and business engagements as delegated, supporting relationship management and assisting with deal follow-ups and closure
	Ensure attention to detail in all administrative and HR-related processes.


Requirements


	Prior experience in an administrative, HR, or executive support role is an added advantage.
	Must reside around Sango Ota, Alakuko, or nearby environs
	Must have completed NYSC
	Strong administrative and organizational skills
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and integrity
	Tech-savvy (comfortable with productivity tools, cloud platforms, and basic digital systems)
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask effectively.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative tech environment
	Exposure to executive-level operations and strategic decision-making
	Professional growth and career development opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: info@nextgenhub.com.ng using "Application for HR / Executive Assistant" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
